questions.title: LRU Cache
questions.prompt: Design and implement an LRU (Least Recently Used) cache with get and put in O(1) average time.
followups: Why do you need both a hash map and a linked list?
What are the edge cases (capacity 0/1, repeated puts, updates)?
How would you make it thread-safe? What are the trade-offs?

questions.title: Top K Frequent Elements
questions.prompt: Given an integer array, return the k most frequent elements. Your solution should be better than O(n log n) if possible.
followups: What approach gives O(n) average time?
How do you handle ties deterministically?
What happens if k is close to n?

questions.title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
questions.prompt: Given a string, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.
followups: What invariant does your sliding window maintain?
How do you implement this efficiently for Unicode?
What are the time and space complexities?

questions.title: Kth Largest Element in an Array
questions.prompt: Find the kth largest element in an unsorted array without fully sorting the array.
followups: Compare heap vs quickselect in average and worst case.
How do you handle many duplicates?
What changes if the input is a stream?

questions.title: Merge Intervals
questions.prompt: Given a list of intervals, merge all overlapping intervals.
followups: Why is sorting helpful here?
What are corner cases (touching endpoints, nested intervals)?
Can you do it in-place and what does that mean here?

questions.title: Binary Tree Level Order Traversal
questions.prompt: Given a binary tree, return the level order traversal of its nodes' values.
followups: What is the space complexity in the worst case?
How would you return the average per level instead of values?
How do you handle very deep trees (stack vs queue concerns)?

questions.title: Lowest Common Ancestor (Binary Tree)
questions.prompt: Given a binary tree and two nodes, find their lowest common ancestor.
followups: How does the solution differ for a BST?
What if one or both nodes may not exist in the tree?
How would you avoid recursion?

questions.title: Detect Cycle in a Linked List
questions.prompt: Determine if a linked list has a cycle and, if so, find the node where the cycle begins.
followups: Explain why Floyd’s algorithm works.
What are time and space complexities?
What changes if nodes can be modified (marking visited)?

questions.title: Product Feature Metrics (Apple-style)
questions.prompt: Pick a feature in an Apple product (e.g., Notes search, Photos memories, iOS keyboard). Propose 2–3 success metrics and how you would instrument them.
followups: How do you avoid optimizing for the wrong metric?
What privacy constraints would you consider?
What would be your rollback plan if metrics degrade?

questions.title: Thread Safety Basics
questions.prompt: Explain race conditions and how you would protect shared data in a multi-threaded program.
followups: Compare mutex vs atomic operations.
What is deadlock and how do you prevent it?
When is immutability the best solution?

questions.title: Memory Management and Leaks
questions.prompt: Explain common causes of memory leaks in managed and unmanaged environments and how you debug them.
followups: What is a retain cycle and how do you prevent it?
How would you confirm a leak vs a cache?
What tools or techniques do you use to diagnose?

questions.title: API Design for a Small Module
questions.prompt: Design a small API for a Settings module that supports reading and updating user preferences safely and predictably.
followups: How do you ensure backward compatibility?
How do you validate and version preference keys?
How do you test this module?

questions.title: Build a Rate Limiter
questions.prompt: Design a rate limiter for an API (e.g., N requests per minute per user). Provide a workable design and complexity.
followups: Compare fixed window vs sliding window.
How do you handle distributed systems?
How do you measure and monitor effectiveness?

questions.title: String Compression
questions.prompt: Implement basic string compression using counts of repeated characters (e.g., aabcccccaaa → a2b1c5a3). Return the original if not shorter.
followups: What is the time and space complexity?
How do you handle digits in the input?
How would you optimize for large strings?

questions.title: Backtracking: Generate Parentheses
questions.prompt: Given n pairs of parentheses, generate all combinations of well-formed parentheses.
followups: What pruning condition prevents invalid generation?
How many outputs exist asymptotically?
How would you convert this to iterative?

questions.title: Matrix Rotate
questions.prompt: Rotate an NxN matrix 90 degrees in-place.
followups: How do you do this layer by layer?
What is the space complexity and why?
What edge cases would you test?

questions.title: Design: Logger with Levels
questions.prompt: Design a logger that supports log levels, formatting, and multiple outputs (console/file). Keep it extensible.
followups: How would you avoid global state?
How would you make it fast (buffering, async)?
How do you test logging behavior?

questions.title: Bug Hunt: Off-by-One in Production
questions.prompt: A feature occasionally crashes when processing the last element in a list. Describe how you would triage, reproduce, and fix it.
followups: What logs or signals would you add first?
How do you write a regression test?
How do you ensure the fix doesn’t cause performance regressions?

questions.title: Design Review: Trade-offs
questions.prompt: You propose a design, but a teammate wants a faster-to-ship implementation that is less clean. How do you handle it?
followups: How do you decide what to simplify?
How do you document technical debt?
How do you align on quality standards?

questions.title: Data Model: Notes Sync (Simplified)
questions.prompt: Design a simple data model and sync strategy for a Notes-like app that supports offline edits and later sync.
followups: How do you resolve conflicts?
What is the minimal metadata you need per note?
What would you test first?

questions.title: Two Sum (Multiple Approaches)
questions.prompt: Given an array of integers and a target sum, find two indices whose values add up to the target.
followups: Compare brute force, hash map, and two-pointer approaches
What if the array is sorted?
How would you handle multiple pairs?

questions.title: Valid Palindrome (Enhanced)
questions.prompt: Given a string, determine if it is a palindrome, considering only alphanumeric characters and ignoring cases.
followups: How would you handle spaces and punctuation?
What's the time and space complexity?
Can you solve it with O(1) extra space?

questions.title: Maximum Subarray (Kadane's Algorithm)
questions.prompt: Find the contiguous subarray with the largest sum.
followups: What's the intuition behind Kadane's algorithm?
How would you modify it to also return the subarray indices?
What if all numbers are negative?

questions.title: Implement Queue using Stacks
questions.prompt: Implement a queue using two stacks with efficient operations.
followups: What's the amortized time complexity?
How would you make peek() efficient?
Can you implement a stack using queues?

questions.title: Group Anagrams
questions.prompt: Given an array of strings, group anagrams together.
followups: What makes a good hash key for anagrams?
How would you handle large strings?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Container With Most Water
questions.prompt: Given n non-negative integers representing heights, find two lines that together with x-axis form a container holding most water.
followups: Why does the two-pointer approach work?
How would you prove its correctness?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: 3Sum
questions.prompt: Find all unique triplets in an array that sum to zero.
followups: How do you avoid duplicate triplets?
What's the time complexity?
How would you adapt for a different target sum?

questions.title: Word Break
questions.prompt: Given a string and a dictionary of words, determine if the string can be segmented into space-separated dictionary words.
followups: What's the recurrence relation?
How would you handle an empty dictionary?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Design a Simple Cache
questions.prompt: Design a cache with TTL (Time To Live) support for key-value pairs.
followups: How do you efficiently remove expired entries?
How would you handle concurrent access?
What about memory constraints?

questions.title: Design a Calendar Event System
questions.prompt: Design a system to store and query calendar events with features like overlapping detection and reminders.
followups: How do you efficiently find overlapping events?
How would you implement recurring events?
What about timezone handling?

questions.title: Design a Photo Gallery App
questions.prompt: Design the backend system for a photo gallery app with features like albums, search, and thumbnail generation.
followups: How do you store and retrieve large numbers of photos efficiently?
How would you implement face recognition grouping?
What about privacy considerations?

questions.title: Design a Music Streaming Service
questions.prompt: Design a basic music streaming service with features like playlists, recommendations, and offline playback.
followups: How do you handle streaming large audio files?
How would you implement shuffle algorithm?
What about licensing and DRM?

questions.title: Design a Messaging App
questions.prompt: Design a messaging app with features like delivery receipts, typing indicators, and media sharing.
followups: How do you handle message delivery guarantees?
How would you implement end-to-end encryption?
What about scalability for millions of users?

questions.title: Design a Health Data System
questions.prompt: Design a system to store and process health data from Apple Watch and other health devices.
followups: How do you ensure data privacy and security?
How would you handle different data types (heart rate, steps, sleep)?
What about data synchronization across devices?

questions.title: SQL: Query Optimization
questions.prompt: Given a slow database query, explain how you would optimize it.
followups: What tools would you use to analyze query performance?
How do indexes help and when do they hurt?
What about query caching strategies?

questions.title: SQL: Data Analysis for App
questions.prompt: Write a query to analyze user engagement for an iOS app with tables for users, sessions, and events.
followups: How would you calculate daily active users?
What about retention rate?
How do you handle timezone differences?

questions.title: Concurrency: Producer-Consumer Pattern
questions.prompt: Implement a producer-consumer pattern with a bounded buffer using threads.
followups: How do you prevent deadlocks?
What about handling multiple producers and consumers?
How would you test this implementation?

questions.title: Concurrency: Read-Write Lock
questions.prompt: Design a read-write lock that allows multiple readers or single writer.
followups: How do you prevent writer starvation?
What about reentrancy?
How would you implement this in Swift/Objective-C?

questions.title: Object Design: Shopping Cart
questions.prompt: Design classes for a shopping cart system for Apple's online store.
followups: How do you handle different product types?
What about discounts and promotions?
How do you ensure thread safety?

questions.title: Object Design: File System
questions.prompt: Design classes to represent a simple file system with files, directories, and permissions.
followups: How do you handle symbolic links?
What about file versioning?
How would you implement search functionality?

questions.title: Behavioral: Technical Challenge
questions.prompt: Tell me about a challenging technical problem you solved and how you approached it.
followups: What made it challenging?
How did you debug the issue?
What did you learn from the experience?

questions.title: Behavioral: Code Review
questions.prompt: Describe your experience with code reviews - both giving and receiving feedback.
followups: What makes a good code review?
How do you handle constructive criticism?
What was the impact of a particularly good code review?

questions.title: Behavioral: Technical Debt
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had to deal with technical debt in a project.
followups: How did you identify the debt?
How did you prioritize addressing it?
What was the result?

questions.title: Behavioral: Cross-Functional Collaboration
questions.prompt: Describe a time you worked with designers or product managers to deliver a feature.
followups: How did you handle differing opinions?
What challenges did you face?
What was the outcome?

questions.title: Behavioral: Handling Production Issues
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had to handle a production issue or outage.
followups: How did you diagnose the issue?
How did you communicate with stakeholders?
What preventive measures did you implement?

questions.title: Behavioral: Learning New Technology
questions.prompt: Describe how you learn new programming languages or frameworks.
followups: What's your learning process?
How do you decide what to learn next?
What was the most challenging technology you learned?

questions.title: Behavioral: Quality Focus
questions.prompt: How do you ensure quality in your code and deliverables?
followups: What testing strategies do you use?
How do you balance speed with quality?
What does quality mean to you in software development?

questions.title: Behavioral: Privacy and Security
questions.prompt: How do you approach privacy and security in your software projects?
followups: What principles guide your approach?
What trade-offs have you faced between features and security?
How do you stay updated on security best practices?

questions.title: Behavioral: User Experience
questions.prompt: How do you incorporate user experience considerations into your technical decisions?
followups: What's an example of a technical decision impacting UX?
How do you gather user feedback?
How do you balance technical elegance with user needs?

questions.title: Behavioral: Innovation at Apple
questions.prompt: What Apple product or technology would you improve, and how?
followups: Why did you choose this product?
What technical challenges would you face?
How would you measure success?

questions.title: Behavioral: Sustainability in Tech
questions.prompt: How can software contribute to environmental sustainability?
followups: What Apple initiatives relate to sustainability?
How can software reduce energy consumption?
Why is this important for technology companies?

questions.title: Technical Trade-offs
questions.prompt: Describe a time you had to make a technical trade-off between performance, maintainability, and time to market.
followups: What factors did you consider?
How did you make your decision?
What was the outcome?

questions.title: Mentoring Experience
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you helped someone else learn or grow technically.
followups: How did you assess their needs?
What approach did you take?
What was the outcome?
